comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Count Franz Xaver Joseph Conrad von Hötzendorf (German: Franz Xaver Josef Graf Conrad von Hötzendorf – the proper family name is Conrad) (11 November 1852 – 25 August 1925) was an Austrian officer and Chief of the General Staff for the whole Armed Might of the Austro-Hungarian Army and Navy during the 1914 July Crisis that led to the outbreak of World War I. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Count_Franz_Conrad_von_H%C3%B6tzendorf
